metadata.notes: Most direct pedagogical comparison: NGSS Science and Engineering Practices (SEPs) align to UK Working Scientifically epistemic skills. SEP 1-8 cover the same inquiry cycle as the UK KS3 Working Scientifically programme of study. Alignments are inferred from structural and pedagogical similarity, not formal crosswalk.

alignments.label: Asking Questions and Defining Problems
alignments.notes: SEP 1 Asking Questions maps to KS3 Working Scientifically: asking scientific questions. Direct structural match.

alignments.label: Developing and Using Models
alignments.notes: SEP 2 Developing and Using Models maps to KS3 Working Scientifically: making and testing predictions using models.

alignments.label: Planning and Carrying Out Investigations
alignments.notes: SEP 3 Planning Investigations maps to KS3 Working Scientifically: planning experiments, identifying variables.

alignments.label: Analysing and Interpreting Data
alignments.notes: SEP 4 Analysing Data maps to KS3 Working Scientifically: presenting and analysing data using appropriate methods.

alignments.label: Using Mathematics and Computational Thinking
alignments.notes: SEP 5 has no exact UK Working Scientifically equivalent; partially maps to KS3 WS measurement and use of mathematical models.

alignments.label: Constructing Explanations and Designing Solutions
alignments.notes: SEP 6 maps to KS3 Working Scientifically: using evidence to construct scientific explanations.

alignments.label: Engaging in Argument from Evidence
alignments.notes: SEP 7 maps to KS3 Working Scientifically: evaluating data and methods, communicating findings.

alignments.label: Obtaining, Evaluating, and Communicating Information
alignments.notes: SEP 8 maps to KS3 Working Scientifically: reading and synthesising information from scientific sources.
